hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Expansion
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a neutral regime (60-70% confidence) and experiences a 3-day consecutive increase in 30-day realized volatility above its 90-day median, followed by a 5% price decline below the 20-day moving average, a transition to a bear regime occurs within 7 trading days with 75% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often break via volatility expansion. Consecutive volatility increases signal distribution/accumulation, while price breaking below key MA with volume confirms directional conviction. Regulatory uncertainty (MiCA/FCA news) creates latent volatility that manifests during technical breaks.
entry_conditions: BTC 30-day realized volatility > 90-day median for 3 consecutive days
BTC price declines 5% below 20-day SMA on day 3
Volume increases 25% above 20-day average on decline day

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price reclaims 20-day SMA and holds for 2 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of signals fail to transition to BEAR within 7 days, or transitions occur to BULL instead of BEAR in >30% of cases.
